courseDescription:
In this free online course, you will learn how the different cognitive processes of the different regions in the brain interact to carry out various mental processes such as; memory formation, learning, attention, decision making and many more. The course begins by examining some techniques and methods that are commonly used in studying a normal brain and those used in studying a damaged brain.

Next, the various parts of the brain and their functions are explained in detail. The inner workings of neurons, as well as the nervous system, are also discussed. The neuroscience of sensation and perceptions, which analyzes the importance and peculiarities of each of the various sense organs, will be explained. The topics will focus on the neural mechanisms behind attention, memory, emotions and language.

The final part of the course will discuss the neuroscience of social cognition which highlights the mental processes that enable proper social interactions between humans. This course will be of interest to students studying neuroscience, psychology or any related field. It will also be beneficial to those who simply want to better understand how the brain works to improve their knowledge. Start this course today.

modules.description: This module presents an introduction to the subject of cognitive neuroscience; neurons and the nervous system. You will also learn about the origins of some of the latest, well-known techniques used in brain analysis today.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, The Human Brain, you will learn about the various structures, functionalities and components that make up the human brain. You will also learn about common deficits that occur as a result of damages to these brain regions.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module examines the neuroscience behind sensation and perception as part of the primary functions of the brain. You will learn how these brain functions influence social interactions and behaviour.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, the various systems involved in the ability to consciously or unconsciously express attention are explained. You will also learn about the causes of some common attention disorders.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the neural basis and mechanisms behind memory. You will also learn about the processes involved in forming different types of memory.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the neuroscience of emotions and how they affect other cognitive processes. You will learn how emotion influences learning, attention, perception and social interactions in general.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will examine the neuroscience of language and how it interacts with other cognitive functions, such as reading, talking, writing, socialising. You will also learn about the neural structures that enable language comprehension.
